snippet: White House officials are looking at a cut that would take the arsenal of deployed weapons to just above 1,000, compared with the current 1,700.
abstract: President Obama plans to use his State of the Union speech to reinvigorate one of his signature security objectives of drastically reducing nuclear arsenals around the world; Obama has secured agreement in recent months with the United States military that the American nuclear force can be cut in size by roughly a third; how to accomplish reduction in the face of Republican opposition in the Senate remains an open question.

byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt and Thom Shanker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: White House officials are looking at a cut that would take the arsenal of deployed weapons to just above 1,000, compared with the current 1,700.

headline.seo: Obama to Renew Drive for Cuts in Nuclear Arms
